text: - My name is Kordell Williams.
And my role here

is Data Center Engineer
Operation Technician.

I started off with an
internship, which was 90 days.
I started off within the data center.

I actually had no previous
technical experience
besides being able to work on a computer.

It was first 90 days
was a lot of studying.
It's also a lot of hands on work.
My eight hour day was the first two hours
was me in my cubicle learning about
what it's really liked being an engineer.
And then the other six hours

I was working with the other
highly qualified engineers

working on generators, racks,
PDUs, and other type of HVACs.
And now after my 90 days, I'm an engineer.

During my internship, they
actually gave me a project.

Within the project, they showed
me what needed to be done
and there was no micromanaging.
I actually got to customize the project
in my own type of way.

I had to schedule maintenance
and I had to figure out
my own type of budgeting.

Within that budgeting, I had
to get the required tools
and equipment to get the job done.
I had no intentions on going to school

or even upgrading my
life in any type of way.
AWS 100% invested in me.

They had me actually
at a community college
for about a couple months
and then I'll be back in my data center.
Nothing's coming outta pocket from me.

I have not had any type of
resources at other jobs.
AWS has been investing in their employees.
(upbeat music)
